title: 2. Bibliography in English (music, culture, identities)
description:
Contents:

Articles:
Araste Lii & Ventsel Aimar, They Have No Right to Wear Those Clothes: the ambivalence of the dress code of German skinheads and Estonian metal heads (2015).
Ashley Martin, The perpetuation of hegemonic male power and the loss of boyhood innocence: case studies from the music industry (2011).
Baltzis Alexandros, Globalization and Musical Culture (2005).
Bennett Andy & Taylor Jodie, Popular music and the aesthetics of ageing (2012).
Crawford Marcus, Grant Natalie & Crews Douglas, Relationships and Rap: Using Ecomaps to Explore the Stories of Youth Who Rap (2014).
Gardikiotis Antonis & Baltzis Alexandros, ‘Rock music for myself and justice to the world!’: Musical identity, values, and music preferences (2010).
Siokou Christine, Seeking the Vibe: the Melbourne rave scene (2002).
Williams Patrick, Authentic Identities: Straightedge Subculture, Music, and the Internet (2006).

Book:
Guerra Paula and Moreira Tânia, Keep it Simple, Make it Fast! An approach to underground music scenes, U.porto (2015).

Abstract from book:
Huron David, Sweet Anticipation: music and the psychology of expectation, MIT Press(2007), pp. 0-57
